holidays.name: World Ice Cream Soda Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to celebrating the fizzy, creamy delight that is the ice cream soda — a refreshing blend of soda pop and ice cream!
holidays.origin: Originated in the 19th century, the ice cream soda became a soda fountain favorite in America, and June 20 became a perfect day to honor this sweet treat in summer.
holidays.funFact: The ice cream soda was invented by Robert McCay Green in 1874 when a customer asked for something different at his soda fountain.

holidays.name: Go Fishing Day
holidays.description: Cast your line and celebrate the joys of fishing, whether it's in a river, lake, or even your backyard pond!
holidays.origin: This unofficial holiday encourages reconnecting with nature and the relaxing sport of fishing.
holidays.funFact: Fishing is one of the oldest human activities, dating back at least 40,000 years!

holidays.name: World Refugee Day
holidays.description: A day to honor the courage and resilience of refugees worldwide and to raise awareness about refugee issues.
holidays.origin: Established by the United Nations in 2000 to commemorate the strength of refugees globally.
holidays.funFact: Every minute, 20 people around the world are forced to flee their homes to escape conflict or persecution.

holidays.name: National Vanilla Milkshake Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the creamy, dreamy delight that is the vanilla milkshake! A perfect chilled treat on a warm June day.
holidays.origin: A food holiday created to honor the classic American milkshake flavor that’s been a staple in diners since the early 1900s.
holidays.funFact: Milkshakes were originally made with malt powder and became wildly popular in the 1920s.
